description: A web-based Job Application Tracker with Kanban board, localStorage persistence, statistics dashboard, and mobile-responsive design

userStories.title: Project Setup and Base Structure
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the base HTML/CSS/JS structure so I can build features on a solid foundation.
acceptanceCriteria: Create index.html with semantic structure (header, main, footer)
Create styles.css with CSS variables for theming (--bg-color, --text-color, --primary-color, etc.)
Create scripts/app.js as main entry point
Set up CSS reset and base typography
Implement responsive breakpoints (mobile: <768px, tablet: 768-1024px, desktop: >1024px)
Page loads without console errors
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Data Model and localStorage Service
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a data layer to persist and retrieve application data.
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/storage.js module
Data structure: { applications: [], contacts: [], interviews: [] }
Application schema: id, companyName, position, jobUrl, dateApplied, salaryMin, salaryMax, location, status, notes, createdAt, updatedAt
Contact schema: id, applicationId, name, role, email, phone, notes
Interview schema: id, applicationId, date, type (phone/video/onsite), notes, completed
All data saves to localStorage under key 'jobTrackerData'
Implement: getApplications(), saveApplication(), deleteApplication(), getContacts(appId), saveContact(), getInterviews(appId), saveInterview()
Data persists after page reload

userStories.title: Kanban Board Layout
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to see my applications organized by status in columns so I can visualize my pipeline.
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/kanban.js module
Display 5 columns: Applied, Screening, Interview, Offer, Rejected
Each column header shows column name and count of applications
Columns use CSS grid/flexbox layout
Empty columns show placeholder message 'No applications'
Columns scroll independently when content overflows
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Application Card Component
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to see application cards in the Kanban columns showing key info.
acceptanceCriteria: Application cards show: company name, position, date applied, location
Cards have distinct visual styling with border/shadow
Cards are rendered in their correct status column
Cards pulled from storage.getApplications()
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Add New Application Modal
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to add new job applications so I can track them.
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/modal.js module
'Add Application' button in header opens modal
Modal form fields: company name (required), position (required), job URL, date applied (default today), salary min, salary max, location
Form validates required fields before submission
New applications default to 'Applied' status
Modal closes on successful save
Escape key closes modal
New application appears in Applied column
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Drag and Drop Between Columns
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to drag applications between columns so I can update their status quickly.
acceptanceCriteria: Implement using HTML5 Drag and Drop API (dragstart, dragover, drop)
Card opacity reduces when dragging
Drop zones highlight when card hovers over them
Status updates in localStorage on drop
Card appears in new column after drop
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Application Details Modal - View and Edit
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to view and edit full details of an application.
acceptanceCriteria: Click on card opens detail modal
Shows all application fields in editable form
Notes section with textarea for freeform text
Save button updates application in storage
Cancel button closes without saving
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Application Details - Contacts Section
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to add contacts to an application to track my connections.
acceptanceCriteria: Detail modal has Contacts section
List existing contacts for the application
Add Contact button opens inline form: name, role, email, phone, notes
New contact saves to storage with applicationId
Contacts persist after closing and reopening modal
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Application Details - Interviews Section
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to track scheduled interviews for an application.
acceptanceCriteria: Detail modal has Interviews section
List existing interviews for the application
Add Interview button opens inline form: date, type (phone/video/onsite), notes
New interview saves to storage with applicationId
Interview can be marked as completed
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Delete Application
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to delete applications I no longer need to track.
acceptanceCriteria: Delete button in application detail modal
Shows confirmation dialog before deleting
Deletes application and associated contacts/interviews from storage
Modal closes and card removed from Kanban board
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Statistics Dashboard - Summary Cards
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to see summary statistics about my job search.
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/stats.js module
Dashboard section above the Kanban board
Display: total applications count
Display: response rate (% of applications moved past 'Applied')
Display: average days to first response (from dateApplied to status change)
Stats update when applications data changes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Statistics Dashboard - Charts
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to see visual charts of my application data.
acceptanceCriteria: Load Chart.js via CDN in index.html
Display pie/doughnut chart showing applications by status
Display line chart showing applications over last 30 days
Charts update when applications data changes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Search and Filter
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to search and filter applications so I can find specific ones quickly.
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/filters.js module
Search bar filters by company name and position (live search on keyup)
Filter dropdown for status (All, Applied, Screening, Interview, Offer, Rejected)
Filter by date range (from/to date pickers)
Filters combine together
Clear filters button resets all
Show count of filtered results
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Export to CSV
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to export my data to CSV so I can backup or analyze in spreadsheet software.
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/export.js module
Export button in header
CSV includes all application fields
Filename format: job-applications-YYYY-MM-DD.csv
Triggers browser download via Blob/URL.createObjectURL
Handles special characters (commas, quotes) correctly with proper escaping

userStories.title: Dark Mode Toggle
userStories.description: As a user, I want to toggle dark mode so I can use the app comfortably in low light.
acceptanceCriteria: Create scripts/theme.js module
Toggle button in header with sun/moon icon
Dark theme swaps CSS variable values
Theme preference saves to localStorage
Respects system preference (prefers-color-scheme) on first load
Smooth CSS transition between themes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Mobile Responsive Design
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to use the app on my phone so I can update applications on the go.
acceptanceCriteria: Kanban columns become horizontally scrollable on mobile (<768px)
Touch-friendly tap targets (min 44px height)
Modals are full-screen on mobile
Statistics charts resize appropriately
All features accessible at 375px width
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Print-Friendly View
userStories.description: As a job seeker, I want to print my applications so I can have a physical reference.
acceptanceCriteria: Add @media print stylesheet
Hide non-essential UI (buttons, navigation, modals)
Applications display in clean table format
Table includes: company, position, status, date applied, location
Fits on standard letter/A4 paper

userStories.title: Demo Data Toggle
userStories.description: As a new user, I want to load sample data so I can explore the app's features.
acceptanceCriteria: 'Load Demo Data' button visible when no applications exist (empty state)
Also accessible from a settings/menu dropdown
Loads 8-10 sample applications across all statuses with varied data
Confirmation dialog before loading warns about existing data
Demo data appears in Kanban board after loading
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
